item.description: Our book for October will be “What?: 108 Zen Poems” by Ko Un, with forewords by Allen Ginsberg and Thich Nhat Hanh, published 2008 by Parallax Press; available in paperback. Hailed as the best collection of Buddhist poems by Korea’s premier poet, this new edition features a more sympathetic translation and original brush drawings by the author. The poems, though strictly within the true Zen tradition, are as witty and down-to-earth as they are contemplative.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a sign on the table that says "book discussion."
item.name: A discussion of "What?: 108 Zen Poems" by Ko Un
